tool.name: Run LAMARC Analysis
tool.command: lamarc.sh ${input_file} ${output} ${output2} ${output3} ${output4} ${output5} ${output6} #if ($random_seed) != 1005: D S $random_seed N #if ($data_model_display.data_model) == "GTR": M C 1 R $first_relat_cat_rate P $first_relat_cat_prob #for $i, $s in enumerate($data_model_display.add_category): $i R ${s.relat_cat_rate} P ${s.relat_cat_prob} enter A ${auto_correlation} #if (data_model_display.data_model) == "F84": T ${tt_ratio} B #if ($rel_base_freq.base_frequencies == "no"): F A $a_freq C $c_freq G $g_freq T $t_freq #else: G 1 $ac_gtr_rate 2 $ag_gtr_rate 3 $at_gtr_rate 4 $cg_gtr_rate 5 $ct_gtr_rate 6 $gt_gtr_rate enter B A $gtr_a_freq C $gtr_c_freq G $gtr_g_freq T $gtr_t_freq enter E $per_base_error_rate R $rel_mute_rate enter A T #if ($growth_rate.set_thetas == "wattersons"): W #elif ($growth_rate.set_thetas == "manual"): 1 $manual_set_theta enter G #if ($display_growth_options.growth_estimate == "yes"): X C $constraints_for_force_growth G $single_growth_estimate enter #if ($recombination.use_recombination == "enabled"): R X C $constraints_for_force_recombination S $start_recombo_rate M $max_recombo_rate enter enter S #if ($type_of_analysis.analysis_type = "likelihood"): #if ($display_rearrangers.change_rearrangers == "yes"): R T $topology_rearranger_freq S $treesize_rearranger_freq H $haplotype_rearranger_freq E $epochsize_rearranger_freq enter #else: P B #if ($change_priors_coalescence.display_priors_coalescence == "yes"):

param.name: first_relat_cat_rate
param.label: First Relative Category Rate
param.help: Mutation rate should be unique for each category

param.name: relat_cat_rate
param.label: Relative Category Rate
param.help: Mutation rate should be unique for each category

param.name: per_base_error_rate
param.label: Per-base error rate
param.help: Value must be less than or equal to 0.1

param.name: set_thetas
param.label: Set Thetas
param.help: Theta (Effective pop. size * mutation rate). Values of theta equal the number of inheritable copies of the data in your population times 2mu. If you have nuclear non-sex chromosomal DNA in your data, this works out to 4Nmu, where N is the effective population size, and mu the mutation rate. Data from X chromosomes is 3Nmu, and data from Y chromosomes and mitochondrial DNA is 1Nmu.

param.name: man_set_theta
param.label: Enter Theta
param.help: (between 1e-10 and 100)

param.name: growth_estimate
param.label: Use Growth Estimatation
param.help: Growth rate: Values of G equal g/mu, where the population size at time t in the past equals the the present population size times exp(-t*g). A shrinking population might have G = -10, while a rapidly growing population might have G = 200

param.name: constraints_for_force_growth
param.label: Constraints for Force: Growth Estimation
param.help: 'Unconstrained' parameters may vary freely, 'constant' parameters are held at their starting value, and 'invalid' parameters are set to zero and ignored in future output.

param.name: single_growth_estimate
param.label: Single growth starting estimate for all data
param.help: Value must be between -5000 and 15000.

param.name: use_recombination
param.label: Recombination
param.help: Recombination parameters: Values of r equal C/mu, and thus can be converted to be in terms of population size by multiplying by the appropriate Theta. e.g. if r is 0.1 and Theta is 0.01 for 4N data, this results in 4NC=0.001 C is the recombination rate per generation per site (*not* per locus!).

param.name: constraints_for_force_recombination
param.label: Constraints for Force: Growth Estimation
param.help: 'Unconstrained' parameters may vary freely, 'constant' parameters are held at their starting value, and 'invalid' parameters are set to zero and ignored in future output.

param.name: start_recombo_rate
param.label: Starting recombination rate
param.help: Starting Value must be be between 0 and 100.

param.name: max_recombo_events
param.label: Maximum number of recombination rates
param.help: Starting value must be greater than 0.

param.name: change_rearrangers
param.label: Display Rearranger options
param.help: Rearrangers Menu: The values set for each arranger indicate the relative amount of time spent performing each type of arrangement. The Tree-size frequency should probably be lower than the the Topology frequency, and in Bayesian runs with multiple parameters, the Bayesian frequency will probably need to be increased.

param.name: topology_rearranger_freq
param.label: Topology rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than 0.

param.name: treesize_rearranger_freq
param.label: Tree-size rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

param.name: haplotype_rearranger_freq
param.label: Haplotype rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

param.name: epochsize_rearranger_freq
param.label: Epoch size rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

param.name: prior_upper_bound
param.label: Upper bound of the prior
param.help: between 1e-05 and 100

param.name: prior_lower_bound
param.label: Lower bound of the prior
param.help: between 1e-10 and upper bound

param.name: change_rearrangers
param.label: Display Rearranger options
param.help: Rearrangers Menu: The values set for each arranger indicate the relative amount of time spent performing each type of arrangement. The Tree-size frequency should probably be lower than the the Topology frequency, and in Bayesian runs with multiple parameters, the Bayesian frequency will probably need to be increased.

param.name: topology_rearranger_freq
param.label: Topology rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than 0.

param.name: treesize_rearranger_freq
param.label: Tree-size rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

param.name: haplotype_rearranger_freq
param.label: Haplotype rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

param.name: bayesian_rearranger_freq
param.label: Bayesian rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than 0.

param.name: epochsize_rearranger_freq
param.label: Epoch size rearranger frequency
param.help: Value must be greater than or equal to 0.

param.name: display_sampling_options
param.label: Change sampling strategy
param.help: chains and replicates

param.name: num_replicates
param.label: Number of replicates
param.help: Must be greater than 0

param.name: num_chains_initial
param.label: Number of chains (initial)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: num_rec_genealogies_initial
param.label: Number of recorded genealogies (initial)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: interval_rec_items_initial
param.label: Interval between recorded items (initial)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: num_samples_discard_initial
param.label: Number of samples to discard (initial burn-in)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: num_chains_final
param.label: Number of chains (final)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: num_rec_genealogies_final
param.label: Number of recorded genealogies (final)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: interval_rec_items_final
param.label: Interval between recorded items (final)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: num_samples_discard_final
param.label: Number of samples to discard (final burn-in)
param.help: Must be greater than or equal to 0

param.name: num_simulatenous_searches
param.label: Number of Simultaneous Searches (Heating)
param.help: Higher-temperature searches investigate more possible solutions but spend proportionately more time evaluating poor candidates. Temperatures will be scaled so the lowest is 1.0

tool.help: This tool runs LAMARC analysis on the file you have provided.
